channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, June 4, 2020

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: Mayor Darcy Byrne said he would explore opportunities to make Newington's facilities accessible to the public before he proceeded with the arrangement.
item.title: Inner West Council to press pause on controversial private school park deal

item.dc:creator: Ella Archibald-Binge
item.description: Protests against police brutality in the US should be a wake-up call about the plight of Indigenous Australians in the justice system, justice advocates say.
item.title: 'It does happen here': Calls to address police brutality in Australia

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: A string of low virus case numbers buoys the state's recovery as the government continues its Queensland holiday drive.
item.title: 'In many ways, we are on the other side': Qld sees light at end of COVID tunnel

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Former Victorian premier Denis Napthine believes the Thoroughbred Aftercare Welfare Working Group will look at every aspect of horse welfare.
item.title: Independent panel launches comprehensive review of racehorse welfare

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: Peter V'landys has been doing his best to unsettle the AFL as the NRL enjoys the limelight, including an audacious bid to stifle the AFL's TV deal.
item.title: NRL turns up code war heat with attempt to sabotage AFL broadcast deal

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: Children aged 12 to 16 who were couch surfing with friends and grandparents to escape problems at home have been turfed out because of the pandemic.
item.title: Young homeless thrown off couches onto streets during COVID-19

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Thursday, June 4

item.description: A former senior Australian army officer who has fought alongside Americans laments the US President's resort to deploying the national guard to quell protests on US streets.
item.title: It's hard not to see the end days of an empire, but America's friends must hope it finds a better path

item.description: You don't have to have your knee on our throats to be holding us down.
item.title: All lives matter, but some more than others

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday, June 4

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Zoom's Australian head Michael Chetner says Google and Microsoft are playing catch up on video conferencing as the company doubles its annual sales forecast.
item.title: Zoom boss says its winning the video conferencing race

item.dc:creator: Benjamen Judd
item.description: From water stations being off-limits to extra spacing between fitness equipment, be prepared for some changes to the way you exercise.
item.title: When gyms reopen, your workout will look very different

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: The consumer watchdog is investigating whether Qantas scuttled a possible privatisation of its regional competitor Alliance Aviation.
item.title: ACCC to probe whether Qantas scuttled rival's takeover talks

item.description: A year after police raids on Australian media that shocked the nation, we still need to remove laws that have amounted to a war on journalism.
item.title: Let's reclaim our freedom and decriminalise journalism

item.description: Employers who ask staff to take unpaid leave need to ensure they stay within lawful bounds.
item.title: Consistent message needed on leave from work

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW MPs will be forced to declare any water ownership or trading under proposed new laws.
item.title: New law to force NSW MPs to declare water ownership

item.description: On the eve of the Tiananmen Square massacre anniversary, we are watching the US deteriorate from a COVID-19 clown show to something far more dismal.
item.title: Loudest voice of retribution and violence is Trump's

item.dc:creator: Brian Yatman
item.description: A season of pestilence, a second New World, and water supply for Newtown
item.title: In the Herald: June 4, 1873

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Liberal Senator Andrew Bragg claims more than $30 million a year will be paid from retirement profits into trade union coffers by 2030.
item.title: Super funds will be 'biggest political donors in Australia': Andrew Bragg

item.description: Amid cheering and singing, Australians for Constitutional Monarchy launched their fight against moves towards a republican Australia.
item.title: From the Archives, 1992: The Queen’s loyal subjects go into battle

item.dc:creator: Jason Steger
item.description: Now is the perfect time to catch up on the best books, films, television shows, music and podcasts you might have missed. Here are five criminally good novels.
item.title: Five classic crime novels to keep you guessing

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Stuart Robert's $721 million robo-debt snafu has presented his opposite number - Bill Shorten - with easy pickings.
item.title: Victors keen to follow up on robo-debt's spoils

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: While most Victorians were grounded by the pandemic, one opposition MP took to the skies.
item.title: State MP flying high despite coronavirus restrictions

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: Massive beer and wine venue metres from Parliament House granted exemption to freeze on late-night liquor licences by Minister.
item.title: Andrews government waves through late-night CBD bar for 1000 drinkers

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: Indigenous voices are simply not being heard by the government departments in charge of delivering their programs.
item.title: We need new ways to listen to Indigenous voices

item.description: The Victorian government should address the issue by finding the most diplomatic way of extricating the state from these agreements while preserving the traditional forums for trade and investment opportunities used by the current state government and its predecessors.
item.title: Victoria needs to get in line with national position on China

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.description: Mumbai has escaped the brunt of a cyclone after winds changed direction and the storm made landfall further south.
item.title: Cyclone Nisarga bears down on India's west coast

item.description: There are better ways to keep tradies in work during a recession, like building more social housing.
item.title: Homeowner handouts are not the best form of stimulus spending

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: The government will on Thursday reveal a $688 million HomeBuilder program, offering Australians $25,000 to build or substantially renovate their home.
item.title: New HomeBuilder package aims to safeguard jobs of a million tradies

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: George Floyd's death at the hands of Minneapolis police has sparked widespread riots in the United States with more than 40 cities in lockdown as demonstrators continue to clash violently with police.
item.title: As the day unfolded: National Guard deployed in New York, LA and Washington as Trump threatens Black Lives Matter demonstrators with US military

item.dc:creator: Craig Butt
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As it happened: Australia in recession as GDP drops 0.3 per cent; Victoria records seven new COVID-19 cases as Australian death toll stands at 102

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: An Australian man's death in Bali is being investigated as a possible coronavirus-caused death.
item.title: Dead man may be first Australian coronavirus fatality in Bali

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Riots across the US

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: West Coast's Dean Cox has become the first player from the Eagles' 2006 premiership team inducted into the Australian Football Hall of Fame.
item.title: Cox and Phillips inducted into Australian Football Hall of Fame

item.description: Let me spell it out for you.
item.title: The collective consciousness crossword challenge

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: An intersection in Morningside has been overlooked for safety upgrades, while a very similar one in Toowong has been given priority.
item.title: A tale of two Brisbane intersections: similar safety issues but only one is a priority

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: LNP has no plans to recriminalise abortion but would "review gestation limits, counselling arrangements and protections against abortion coercion".
item.title: LNP plans to review Labor's historic 2018 abortion reform if elected

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: The candles in Brisbane's Musgrave Park were lit by Indigenous campaigners quietly supporting international protests over black deaths in custody.
item.title: Candles spell out 'I Can't Breathe' as Queenslanders stand in solidarity with George Floyd protests

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Another major pay dispute looms if players do not accept Cricket Australia's belated financial projections.
item.title: CA braces for a potential pay dispute with players

item.description: Sweden's top epidemiologist, Anders Tegnell, has admitted his strategy to fight COVID-19 resulted in too many deaths, after persuading his country to avoid a strict lockdown.
item.title: Man behind Sweden's controversial coronavirus strategy admits mistakes

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: A survey of nearly 900 women finds many more would walk or cycle if there were separate and safer bike paths, lanes and walking tracks.
item.title: No lycra in sight: Why more women aren't cycling or walking

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: The chair of Australia's Foreign Affairs committee, David Fawcett, joined with his counterparts from the UK, Canada and New Zealand on Wednesday to urge the United Nations to appoint a special human rights envoy.
item.title: UK, Australian MPs call for HK human rights envoy as Lam says citizens 'have nothing to fear'

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Swinburne University has told workers to brace for job losses, while Deakin University staff lash out at "hunger games" redundancy process.
item.title: Swinburne staff warned of job cuts as universities' COVID-19 woes grow

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Former ambassador to the United States Dennis Richardson says the riots raging across America have been made worse by Donald Trump's divisive leadership, the growth in armed militias, coronavirus and the biggest economic downturn since the 1930s.
item.title: 'Trump thrives on division': Former envoy says American leadership making riots worse

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: You'd think the NRL would be content with two new taxpayer-funded stadiums at a time when other industries are on their knees. But you'd be wrong.
item.title: NRL's new pitch for stadium cash is so greedy it's offensive

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Rugby Australia is close to signing off on rule changes for next month's domestic competition, and some of them have a slight rugby league flavour.
item.title: Goal-line drop-outs, 50-22s and 20-minute red cards: Rugby Australia's proposed rule changes

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Australia is backing the regional offices of the World Health Organisation while criticising Geneva amid new revelations about its mishandling of the coronavirus.
item.title: WHO chief 'went too far' praising Beijing, as new report reveals coronavirus delays

item.description: Immobilisation techniques where officers apply pressure with their knees on prone suspects have been blamed for asphyxiations and other deaths in police custody beyond US shores, often involving non-white suspects.
item.title: 'Dangerous': Around the world, police chokeholds are being scrutinised
